12511211.content:
You enjoyed the sensation of cool water on your smooth, sensitive new skin. Sara's body is lithe and graceful, far more flexible and coordinated than your clunky old male body. You easily glide through the water, with Sara's reflexes instinctively making all the right motions for the various swim strokes.

“Being on the girls swim team will be easier than I thought,” you whisper to yourself.

Just then, you spot Sara, in your old body, stepping out wearing nothing but a pair of your black swim trunks. She looks skittish and nervous, the way she's clutching a towel over her bare chest where her breasts used to be. She's a fifteen-year old boy now, although her body language is still that of a thirteen-year old girl. She takes a few small, hesitant steps towards the pool.

“What's the matter, bro?” you tease. “Come on in, John! The water's fine.”

Still looking intensely uncomfortable, Sara finally puts down the towel and awkwardly clambers into the pool with a clumsy splash.

“Listen Sara, we've got to talk about something,” she says, swimming up to you.

“Sure, John,” you tell her. “You can share anything with me. What's troubling you?”

She looks around the pool nervously, to assure herself no one else is around to overhear your conversation.

“Are … Are you sure you're Sara?” she asks, with a quavering tremor in your old voice.

“I've told you like three times already!” you say with a feminine giggle. “I'm me and you're you. I'm Sara and you're John. What's going on anyhow?”

“It's that business with the fortune cookies,” she says. “You remember that?”

“That was just a dumb game,” you tell her. “People only switch bodies in lame movies.”

“Well, maybe nothing happened to you,” Sara says. “And I guess that's good. But … well, you have to swear you won't tell anyone about this.”

“I swear,” you solemnly say.

“I think I used to be you,” she says. “I know I'm supposed to be John. I have his body. I'm a guy and you're a girl. And if you say nothing happened … then … I don't know, Sara. I think I got somehow cursed so that your personality leaked into me. Because I don't know anything about being John. I only remember being Sara. It's like I'm a girl trapped in a boy's body. I just want to be a girl again … but I know I never was a girl. I've always been John, and only just now lost my memories or something. Please Sara, you've got to understand! You're me too, only you still have the right body at least.”

You look at your confused, blubbering sister making a ridiculous scene in your old body.

What to do, you think. What to do?
12511211.title: The Truth ... or Not?

choices: She reluctantly agrees to be you for just a little while.
She demands you look for a way to swap back right now.
125112111.content:
You frowned at the crying boy in front of you. Sara was making you look bad.

No, you told yourself, John was making himself look bad.

...No, that was Sara alright. And she wasn't going to accept otherwise. You finally began to feel some guilt for trying to steal her identity.

"Awww, you're no fun, sis," you reluctantly said.

Sara whipped your old head upward and stared at you with a mix of a dozen emotions. "John?!"

"Yep, I'm John... or at least I used to be," you said.

"So... you were just pretending to be me?" Sara asked, beginning to sound angry. "You... you jerk! Why would you even do that!?" She threw her arms down in frustration, splashing water on your face.

"Because... because it's fun," you said, avoiding eye contact.

"What?" Sara said in a tone of utter disbelief. "But... you're supposed to be a boy! Are you telling me you're enjoying being a girl?"

"Well... yes! I-I mean, at least for a while, you know?" you said with a weak smile. "Come on, Sara, don't you think this is cool at all? I mean, doesn't it make you curious about what it's like being me? How about we try living as each other, just for a few days?"

The truth, of course, was that you hoped to stay as Sara for a lot longer than a few days, but she obviously wouldn't react well to that.

With a grimace, Sara looked down at her new male body, clutching her arm in another bit of jarringly feminine body language. You anxiously waited for her to say something.
125112111.title: Drop the act

1251121112.content:
“No. We need to find a way to turn back right now,” he demanded.

“No… Please don’t… I don’t want to be a boy,” she slowly backed away mortified. Her sister was shocked that she wanted to be a girl so badly.

“Do you really want to be a girl that badly…?” her sister asked

“Y…Yeah… I always thought that there was something wrong with my life, but I only realised after I swapped how truly happy I am now. I don’t want you to be miserable though, if only there was a way for us to both be what we want to be” she replied.

“Fine… I won’t force you to turn back right away, but I don’t want to be stuck like this forever,” her sister said.

“Thanks,” she sighed.

“What would everyone think, if they knew you wanted to be a girl?” her sister teased.

“That would be really embarrassing, if I was a boy,” she blushed and her sister laughed.
1251121112.title: She demands you look for a way to swap back rig...

125112112.content: You call up take out for china food then Sara's mind matchs her body
125112112.title: Back to the fortune cookies! Make a wish that &...

info.brief_description: A boy swaps bodies with his little sister!
info.description:
Just follow my lead, and keep it as realistic as possible. No sloppy writing.

You are a boy named John (15).

Your sister's name is Sara (13).
